Songs, Memories, and the Shit I Canâ€™t Escape

â¤ï¸ Krishna Chaitanya September 13, 2022

Yesterday

I finally decided to go to college after skipping for 11 days. IT lab attendance was my excuse, but honestly, I just needed hard disks. Called Nitheesh to ask about the bus timingâ€”7 AM. I hurried, reached the stop, and thenâ€”fuckâ€”I forgot my ID card. Ran back, grabbed it, somehow made it in time.

Got in, sat down, plugged in my earphones, and pressed play. Nothing.

Shit.

I left my iPod drained for 10 days. No charge. No AirPods either. Now I had no choice but to listen to people around meâ€”some discussing exams, some talking about cricket, and some just laughing for no reason. I wanted to escape. I leaned back, tried to sleep, but my mind wouldnâ€™t shut up.

And thenâ€¦ in the background, someoneâ€™s phone speaker.

A song.

Not just any song. That song.

The one I looped day and night after she left.

And suddenly, I wasnâ€™t in 2022 anymore. I was back in 2014.

The Bus Ride to the Past

I could feel it. The moment. The memory.2014. January or Marchâ€”I donâ€™t even remember. What I do remember is missing my usual bus that day and taking the one she used to take. Mayura Sugars, a private company bus. She was there.

And in the backgroundâ€”playing faintlyâ€”was Sweety from Race Gurram.

Itâ€™s funny how a song can bring back a whole timeline. One second, Iâ€™m a college kid staring out the window, and the next, Iâ€™m a school kid again, sitting in that bus, stealing glances at her, living in that moment.

For a minute, I felt happy. Like I had traveled back in time.

Then reality punched me in the face.

I took out my phone, opened our chat. Dry, lifeless, just an old thread of meaningless messages. Checked her photo. Stared at it for a while.

Then locked my phone.

The bus reached college. The usual routine. Sat in class, zoned out, finished lab, came back home at 6 PM.

Wanted to call her. Didnâ€™t. Something in me stopped me.

Slept early. Journey drained me.

Today

No labs. No important classes. But I went to college anyway.

Being alone in my room felt worse.

This time, I made sure my iPod was charged. Sat in the bus, plugged in, and played Dawn FM. Fucking mistake. It didnâ€™t help. Just made me feel worse, like my whole life was some kind of joke.

First class started. I wasnâ€™t paying attention. My brain was stuck in some old-ass playlist from 2014. I remembered how I used to drown in those songs after she left.

I couldnâ€™t sit there anymore.

Got up. Walked out. Needed some air.

I wanted to go to the terrace, but the upstairs door was locked. Took another way up, found a quiet spot, sat down, and opened my Harshi playlistâ€”just 11 songs.

I hit play.

And just like that, I was 10 years old again.

The happiness of having her. The pain of losing her. The emptiness that followed.

I thought those days were perfect with her. But sheâ€™s gone now.

And even though sheâ€™s just a call away, I canâ€™t call her. I wonâ€™t.

I donâ€™t know why.

Iâ€™m just stuck here.

Trying to move on.

But every damn thing keeps dragging me back.

Again and again.
